sentences.en: A High Court judge had awarded him £6 million damages.
sentences.cn: 高级法院法官裁定他获得600万英镑的损失赔偿金。

sentences.en: Do not judge her too harshly, as she was very young at the time.
sentences.cn: 对她的评价不要太苛刻，毕竟那时候她还很年轻。

sentences.en: He stood emotionless as he heard the judge pass sentence.
sentences.cn: 他面无表情地站在那里，听法官宣布判决。

sentences.en: He was elected judge in the fall of 1991.
sentences.cn: 1991年秋他当选为法官。

sentences.en: His conduct, judged objectively by what he has done, is dishonest.
sentences.cn: 他的行为，从他所做的这一切客观地来评价，是不诚实的。

sentences.en: His nine-month sentence was overturned by Appeal Court judge Lord Justice Watkins.
sentences.cn: 上诉法院法官沃特金斯撤销了对他作出的9个月徒刑的判决。

sentences.en: I am in no position to judge whether what she is doing is right or wrong.
sentences.cn: 我无权评判她在做的事是对是错。

sentences.en: I gather his report is highly critical of the trial judge.
sentences.cn: 据我所知，他在报道中毫不留情地批评了初审法官。

sentences.en: It would be presumptuous to judge what the outcome will be.
sentences.cn: 现在就判断结果将会怎样未免有些冒昧。

sentences.en: Judge us on the improvements we make in the economy.
sentences.cn: 请根据我们在经济方面取得的进步来评价我们。

sentences.en: Patrick Devlin was an outstanding judge and brilliant jurist.
sentences.cn: 帕特里克·德夫林是一位杰出的法官和出色的法律专家。

sentences.en: pollutants that were judged hazardous to human health
sentences.cn: 被认为对人体健康有害的污染物

sentences.en: Robert wanted to go and help him, but judged it best to stay where he was.
sentences.cn: 罗伯特想过去帮他，但考虑之后还是觉得待在原地为妙。

sentences.en: The economic results of the reforms are very difficult to judge.
sentences.cn: 这些改革所带来的经济成效很难评价。

sentences.en: The judge called the decision "a flagrant violation of international law"
sentences.cn: 法官称这一决定是“对国际法的公然违背”。

sentences.en: The judge described the offences as nauseating and unspeakable.
sentences.cn: 法官将这些犯罪行为描述为“令人作呕、说不出口”。

sentences.en: The judge recommended that he serve 20 years in prison.
sentences.cn: 法官建议判处他20年监禁。

sentences.en: The judge said the police had mishandled the siege.
sentences.cn: 法官说警方对围攻安排不当。

sentences.en: The judge shook his head irritably and Juicks hushed.
sentences.cn: 法官生气地摇摇头，朱克斯安静下来。

sentences.en: The judge should not have left it to the jury to decide.
sentences.cn: 法官本不该把案子交给陪审团来裁定。

sentences.en: The judge thought he'd been led astray by older children.
sentences.cn: 法官认为他已经被那些年长的孩子们带坏了。

sentences.en: The likelihood of future bombs was impossible to judge.
sentences.cn: 未来发生爆炸案的可能性无法预测。

sentences.en: The panel of judges included several well-known writers.
sentences.cn: 评审团包括几位著名作家。

sentences.en: The therapist judged that Margaret had made a serious attempt to kill herself.
sentences.cn: 治疗专家断定玛格丽特曾真的企图自杀。

sentences.en: The trial judge specifies the number of years to be spent in prison.
sentences.cn: 由主审法官确定刑期。

sentences.en: There was pandemonium in court as the judge gave his summing-up.
sentences.cn: 法官的结案陈词在法庭上引起一片混乱。

sentences.en: We judge the success of a product by the number of sales it brings in.
sentences.cn: 我们以销量来评价一种产品成功与否。

sentences.en: You should never judge a person by their looks.
sentences.cn: 决不要以貌取人。
